If good men and good women uphold the names of these Buddhas, they will never enter hell and will quickly attain samÄdhi.
ÅšÄriputra!
After an immeasurable, boundless, incalculable eon beyond this, there was a Buddha named NÄrÄyaá¹‡a. You should take refuge in him.

The lifespan of that Buddha was seventy million eons, and in his first assembly, three hundred million Å›rÄvaka disciples gathered, as well as eighty nayutas of ten thousands of bodhisattva disciples, all of whom had attained the various spiritual powers, were endowed with the four unobstructed [abilities], and had thoroughly penetrated emptiness and reached the other shore.
If I were to dwell in the world for innumerable eons, describing the Buddha's great assembly and the adornments of his land, it would be like a single drop of water from the great ocean.
ÅšÄriputra!
You should respectfully bow to the great bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas in the ten directions.

Homage to the Bodhisattva Cutting Off All DemonsğŸ”½Homage to the Bodhisattva Transcending All PathsHere is the text with the alignment mistakes fixed and the English translations updated to match the Sanskrit:
The Buddha told ÅšÄriputra:
